article.paragraph: Bowie married Mary Angela Barnett (also known asAngela BowieAngie Bowie) on 19 March 1970 at Bromley Register Office on Beckenham Lane,Bromley, London. They had a son together, Zowie Bowie (now known asDuncan Jones, film director), and divorced on 8 February 1980 in Switzerland.Doggett (2011): p. 114

On 24 April 1992, David Bowie married Somali-American modelIman (model)Imanin a private ceremony inLausanne. The wedding was later solemnized on 6 June in Florence.cite bookPeggNicholasThe Complete David Bowie2006Reynolds & Hearn1905287151238They have one daughter, Alexandria "Lexi" Zahra Jones, born in August 2000.cite webhttp://ca.eonline.com/uberblog/b40304_first_look_news_in_brief_august_15_2000.htmlFIRST LOOK: The News in Brief, 15 August 200015 August 2000E! Online22 September 2014The couple resides primarily in New York City and London.cite webhttp://www.fashionmodeldirectory.com/news/Model+News/still-ties-shoes-for-iman-reveals-how-david-bowie-makes-her-feel-special.htmImanThe FMD - FashionModelDirectory.com22 September 2014

Regarding his religion, in 2005 he said, "Questioning my spiritual life has always been germane to what I was writing. Always." He added that he is bothered by being "not quite an atheist".cite bookAnthony DeCurtisIn Other Words: Artists Talk About Life And Workhttps://books.google.com/books?id14 May 20125 May 2005Hal Leonard Corporation978-0-634-06655-9262–263In theEsquire (magazine)Esquireinterview "What I've Learned", he stated, "I'm in awe of the universe, but I don't necessarily believe there's an intelligence or agent behind it. I do have a passion for the visual in religious rituals, though, even though they may be completely empty and bereft of substance. The incense is powerful and provocative, whether Buddhist or Catholic."cite webhttp://www.esquire.com/features/what-ive-learned/ESQ0304-MAR_WILWhat I've Learned: David Bowie29 February 2004Hearst CommunicationsEsquire10 August 2012

Bowie has shown an interest inBuddhismsince 1967. He frequently studied in London under theTibetan peopleTibetanLamaChime Rinpochebefore becoming a solo artist. During a 2001 interview, Bowie claimed that "after a few months of study, he told me, 'You don't want to be Buddhist ... You should follow music.' "newsday.com:Stardust Memories / Without Tibet House, David Bowie never may have gotten Ziggy with it. Now the pop star returns the favor by performing at the annual benefit concert.

Bowie later wrote the song "Silly Boy Blue" in tribute to Rinpoche on his 1967 albumDavid Bowie (1967 album)David Bowie. Bowie also became a student of theCrazy wisdomTulkuChgyam Trungpa.Shambhala SunSpace Bringing Chogyam Trungpa's "Crazy Wisdom" to the screen A conversation with filmmaker Johanna Demetrakas
article.heading: Fascism controversy
article.paragraph: Speaking asThe Thin White Duke, Bowie's persona at the time, and "at least partially tongue-in-cheek", he made statements that expressed support forfascismand perceived admiration forAdolf Hitlerin interviews withPlayboy,NMEand a Swedish publication. Bowie was quoted as saying: "Britain is ready for a fascist leader... I think Britain could benefit from a fascist leader. After all, fascism is really nationalism... I believe very strongly in fascism, people have always responded with greater efficiency under a regimental leadership." He was also quoted as saying: "Adolf Hitler was one of the first rock stars" and "You've got to have anFar-right politicsextreme rightfront come up and sweep everything off its feet and tidy everything up."cite webhttp://www.rollingstone.com/music/videos/flashback-the-clash-rock-against-racism-in-1978-20140513Flashback: The Clash Rock Against Racism in 1978Rolling Stone15 January 2015cite webhttp://www.theguardian.com/music/2008/apr/20/popandrock.race1978, the year rock found the power to uniteSarfraz Manzoorthe Guardian15 January 2015
article.heading: Legal issues
article.paragraph: Following Vanilla Ice's studio albumTo The Extremein 1990, British rock band Queen and artist David Bowie filed a lawsuit againstVanilla Icefor illegally sampling the bass line of "Under Pressure".CitationConlonJamesIce, Ice, Maybe – Check Out the Hook and Hope Bowie Absolveshttp://www.ipbrief.net/2011/03/08/ice-ice-maybe–-check-out-the-hook-and-hope-bowie-absolves-it/10 February 2015The lawsuit charged to Vanilla Ice was copyright infringement for not gaining consent from Queen and David Bowie for the use of a similar instrumental.Vanilla Ice altered the rhythm of his hit singleIce, Ice, Baby; thinking that the Under Pressure bass line would be unquestioned when heard.CitationPotashnickM.WeinhausS.Famous Copyright Infringement Plagiarism cases in Musichttp://www.fairwagelawyers.com/most-famous-music-copyright-infringment.html10 February 2015The dispute was later resolved with an out-of-court settlement, where Vanilla Ice offered an undisclosed amount.
article.heading: Sexual orientation
article.paragraph: Buckley writes, "If Ziggy confused both his creator and his audience, a big part of that confusion centred on the topic of sexuality."Buckley (2005): p. 140Bowie declared himself gay in an interview with Michael Watts in 22 January 1972 issue ofMelody Maker,cite newsWattsMichaelOn the cusp of fame, Bowie tells Melody Maker he's gay – and changes pop for everhttp://www.guardian.co.uk/music/2006/jan/22/popandrock.davidbowie11 August 2012The Observer22 January 2006a move which coincided with the first shots in his campaign for stardom as Ziggy Stardust.In a September 1976 interview withPlayboy, Bowie said: "It's trueI am a bisexual. But I can't deny that I've used that fact very well. I suppose it's the best thing that ever happened to me."cite webhttp://www.playboy.com/articles/david-bowie-interview/index.html?pageInterview: David BowieSeptember 1976Playboy14 September 2010https://web.archive.org/web/20100801045250/http://www.playboy.com/articles/david-bowie-interview/index.html?page1 August 2010According to his first wife Angie, Bowie had a relationship with Mick Jagger.cite bookAndersenChristopherJuly 2012Mick: the Wild Life and Mad Genius of JaggerRobson Press978-1849543828

In a 1983 interview withRolling Stone, Bowie said his public declaration of bisexuality was "the biggest mistake I ever made" and "I was always a closet heterosexual."Cite newsDavid Bowie Calls Himself 'A Closet Heterosexual'orlandosentinel.comOrlando Sentinel30 May 199313 May 2012http://articles.orlandosentinel.com/1993-05-30/news/9305300344_1_david-bowie-mick-jagger-ziggyOn other occasions, he said his interest in homosexual and bisexual culture had been more a product of the times and the situation in which he found himself than his own feelings; as described by Buckley, he said he had been driven more by "a compulsion to flout moral codes than a real biological and psychological state of being."Buckley (2000): p. 401Buckley (2005): p. 106

Asked in 2002 byBlender (magazine)Blenderwhether he still believed his public declaration was the biggest mistake he ever made, he replied:blockquote<arg name="Interesting. [Long pause] I don't think it was a mistake in Europe, but it was a lot tougher in America. I had no problem with people knowing I was bisexual. But I had no inclination to hold any banners nor be a representative of any group of people. I knew what I wanted to be, which was a songwriter and a performer, and I felt that bisexuality became my headline over here for so long. America is a very puritanical place, and I think it stood in the way of so much I wanted to do.{{Cite news |last">Collis| first

Buckley's view of the period is that Bowie, "a taboo-breaker and a dabbler ... mined sexual intrigue for its ability to shock",Buckley (2005): p. 141and that "it is probably true that Bowie was never gay, nor even consistently actively bisexual ... he did, from time to time, experiment, even if only out of a sense of curiosity and a genuine allegiance with the 'transgressional.' "Buckley (2005): p. 147Biographer Christopher Sandford says that according to Mary Finnigan, with whom Bowie had an affair in 1969, the singer and his first wife Angie "lived in a fantasy world ... and they created their bisexual fantasy."Sandford (1997): p. 48Sandford tells how, during the marriage, Bowie "made a positive fetish of repeating the quip that he and his wife had met while 'fucking the same bloke' ... Gay sex was always an anecdotal and laughing matter. That Bowie's actual tastes swung the other way is clear from even a partial tally of his affairs with women."

In 1999, Bowie was made a Commander of theOrdre des Arts et des Lettresby the French government.cite newshttp://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/europe/the-big-question-how-does-the-french-honours-system-work-and-why-has-kylie-been-decorated-822752.htmlThe Big Question: How does the French honours system work, and why has Kylie been decorated?LichfieldJohn8 May 2009The IndependentUK17 September 2010He received an honorary doctorate fromBerklee College of Musicthe same year.cite webhttp://www.berklee.edu/news/1999/grad99.htmlChChChChanges[[Berklee College of Music]]berklee.edu17 September 2010He declined the royal honour ofOrder of the British EmpireCommander of the British Empirein 2000, and turned down aknighthoodin 2003.cite newsThompsonJodySixty things about David Bowie(No. 35): BBC News8 January 2007http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/entertainment/6230201.stm17 September 2010
